LanguageData.Concussion.label: concussion
LanguageData.Concussion.description: A concussion, also known as a mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI), is a head injury that temporarily affects brain functioning. Symptoms may include loss of consciousness; memory loss; headaches; difficulty with thinking, concentration, or balance; nausea; blurred vision; dizziness; sleep disturbances, and mood changes.\n\nShould resolve on its own within a few days, but can be worsened by repeated head injuries.
LanguageData.Concussion.stages.headache.label: headache
LanguageData.Concussion.stages.severe_headache.label: severe headache
LanguageData.Concussion.stages.confused.label: confused
LanguageData.Concussion.stages.uncounscious.label: uncounscious
